chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: JBoss Messaging provides an open source and standards-based messaging platform and is an integral part of Red Hat's strategy for enterprise messaging. It is a complete rewrite of JBossMQ, the legacy JBoss JMS provider, and offers improved performance in both single node and clustered environments. It also features a much better modular architecture that allows easy adding of new features in the future.

note.para: JBoss Messaging 1.4 is the default JMS provider in JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 4.3.

section.title: Feedback
section.para: If you spot a typo in this guide, or if you have thought of a way to make this manual better, we would love to hear from you!
